trans-unit.source: Using a DSC report server
trans-unit.target: Using a DSC report server

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: **Note:** The report server described in this topic is not availalbe in PowerShell 4.0.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** The report server described in this topic is not availalbe in PowerShell 4.0.

trans-unit.source: For reporting in PowerShell 4.0, see Using a DSC compliance server.
trans-unit.target: For reporting in PowerShell 4.0, see Using a DSC compliance server.

trans-unit.source: The Local Configuration Manager (LCM) of a node can be configured to send reports about its configuration status to a pull server, which can then be queried to retrieve that data.
trans-unit.target: The Local Configuration Manager (LCM) of a node can be configured to send reports about its configuration status to a pull server, which can then be queried to retrieve that data.

trans-unit.source: Each time the node checks and applies
trans-unit.target: Each time the node checks and applies

trans-unit.source: a configuration, it sends a report to the report server.
trans-unit.target: a configuration, it sends a report to the report server.

trans-unit.source: These reports are stored in a database on the server, and can be retrieved by calling the reporting web service.
trans-unit.target: These reports are stored in a database on the server, and can be retrieved by calling the reporting web service.

trans-unit.source: Each report contains
trans-unit.target: Each report contains

trans-unit.source: information such as what configurations were applied and whether they succeeded, the resources used, any errors that were thrown, and start and finish times.
trans-unit.target: information such as what configurations were applied and whether they succeeded, the resources used, any errors that were thrown, and start and finish times.

trans-unit.source: Configuring a node to send reports
trans-unit.target: Configuring a node to send reports

trans-unit.source: You tell a node to send reports to a server by using a **ReportServerWeb** block in the node's LCM configuration (for information about configuring the LCM,
trans-unit.target: You tell a node to send reports to a server by using a **ReportServerWeb** block in the node's LCM configuration (for information about configuring the LCM,

trans-unit.source: see [Configuring the Local Configuration Manager](metaConfig.md)).
trans-unit.target: see [Configuring the Local Configuration Manager](metaConfig.md)).

trans-unit.source: The server to which the node sends reports must be set up as a web pull server (you cannot send reports
trans-unit.target: The server to which the node sends reports must be set up as a web pull server (you cannot send reports

trans-unit.source: to an SMB share).
trans-unit.target: to an SMB share).

trans-unit.source: For information about setting up a pull server, see [Setting up a DSC web pull server](pullServer.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about setting up a pull server, see [Setting up a DSC web pull server](pullServer.md).

trans-unit.source: The report server can be the same service from which
trans-unit.target: The report server can be the same service from which

trans-unit.source: the node pulls configurations and gets resources, or it can be a different service.
trans-unit.target: the node pulls configurations and gets resources, or it can be a different service.

trans-unit.source: In the **ReportServerWeb** block, you specify the URL of the pull service
trans-unit.target: In the **ReportServerWeb** block, you specify the URL of the pull service

trans-unit.source: and a registration key that is known to the server.
trans-unit.target: and a registration key that is known to the server.

trans-unit.source: The following configuration configures a node to pull configurations from one service, and send reports
trans-unit.target: The following configuration configures a node to pull configurations from one service, and send reports

trans-unit.source: to a service on a different server.
trans-unit.target: to a service on a different server.

trans-unit.source: The following configuration configures a node to use a single server for configurations, resources, and reporting.
trans-unit.target: The following configuration configures a node to use a single server for configurations, resources, and reporting.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** You can name the web service whatever you want when you set up a pull server, but the **ServerURL** property must match the service name.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** You can name the web service whatever you want when you set up a pull server, but the **ServerURL** property must match the service name.

trans-unit.source: Getting report data
trans-unit.target: Getting report data

trans-unit.source: Reports sent to the pull server are entered into a database on the server.
trans-unit.target: Reports sent to the pull server are entered into a database on the server.

trans-unit.source: The reports are available through calls to the web service.
trans-unit.target: The reports are available through calls to the web service.

trans-unit.source: To retrieve reports for a specific node,
trans-unit.target: To retrieve reports for a specific node,

trans-unit.source: send an HTTP request to the report web service in the following form:
trans-unit.target: send an HTTP request to the report web service in the following form:

trans-unit.source: where `MyNodeAgentId` is the AgentId of the node for which you want to get reports.
trans-unit.target: where `MyNodeAgentId` is the AgentId of the node for which you want to get reports.

trans-unit.source: You can get the AgentID for a node by calling [Get-DscLocalConfigurationManager](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn407378.aspx)
trans-unit.target: You can get the AgentID for a node by calling [Get-DscLocalConfigurationManager](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn407378.aspx)

trans-unit.source: on that node.
trans-unit.target: on that node.

trans-unit.source: The reports are returned as an array of JSON objects.
trans-unit.target: The reports are returned as an array of JSON objects.

trans-unit.source: The following script returns the reports for the node on which it is run:
trans-unit.target: The following script returns the reports for the node on which it is run:

trans-unit.source: Viewing report data
trans-unit.target: Viewing report data

trans-unit.source: If you set a variable to the result of the **GetReport** function, you can view the individual fields in an element of the array that is returned:
trans-unit.target: If you set a variable to the result of the **GetReport** function, you can view the individual fields in an element of the array that is returned:

trans-unit.source: Notice that the **StatusData** field is an object with three properties: **NumberOfResources**, **Locale**, and **ResourcesInDesiredState**.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the **StatusData** field is an object with three properties: **NumberOfResources**, **Locale**, and **ResourcesInDesiredState**.

trans-unit.source: The **ResourcesInDesiredState**
trans-unit.target: The **ResourcesInDesiredState**

trans-unit.source: property is an array of objects that each have a number of properties.
trans-unit.target: property is an array of objects that each have a number of properties.

trans-unit.source: The following script takes a single report as a parameter, iterates through its **ResourcesInDesiredState**
trans-unit.target: The following script takes a single report as a parameter, iterates through its **ResourcesInDesiredState**

trans-unit.source: array, and writes them to the console:
trans-unit.target: array, and writes them to the console:

trans-unit.target: Here is a sample output after calling the **GetStatusData** function:

trans-unit.source: Note that these examples are meant to give you an idea of what you can do with report data.
trans-unit.target: Note that these examples are meant to give you an idea of what you can do with report data.

trans-unit.source: For an introduction on working with JSON in PowerShell, see
trans-unit.target: For an introduction on working with JSON in PowerShell, see

trans-unit.source: [Playing with JSON and PowerShell](https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/heyscriptingguy/2015/10/08/playing-with-json-and-powershell/).
trans-unit.target: [Playing with JSON and PowerShell](https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/heyscriptingguy/2015/10/08/playing-with-json-and-powershell/).
